Detailed Description

TREX agent.

This class implements the TREX agent. It extends the graph concept by:

  • enforcing that there's no cyclic dependency between reactors
  • calling the different methods of the reactors in order to execute them

The execution of the reactors is made according to a clock which the agent observes in order to idenitfy a new tick that will gives the rythm of execution

As soon as the reactor graph as been fully loaded the agent will call in each reactors the TeleoReactor::initialize method while controlling that there's no cyclic dependencies in the graph and idenitfy if there's some Internal timelines missing.

After this ti will start the clock and ate each tick will execute the following callbacks of the reactors int the following order

  • TeleoReactor::newTick indicate to each reactor that a new tick have started
  • TeleoReactor::doSynchronize() require to each reactors to identify their current state based on the observation they did receive and potentially produce new observation on their intiernal timelines
  • TeleoReactor::workRatio() identify each reactor workload for scedulling their deliberation
  • TeleoReactor::step() is called only if a reactor have works (idenitifed by the fact that is workRatio() was not NAN). It allow the reactor to do a single step in roder to deliberate.

Do note that ass all theses called have to be executed in the duration of a TICK all of these should be executed in a duration that is well below the tick granularity of the clock used by the agent.

Author:
Frederic Py <fpy@mbari.org>
See also:
class TREX::transaction::TeleoReactor
class Clock

Member Typedef Documentation

typedef std::multimap< double, reactor_id, std::greater<double> > TREX::agent::Agent::priority_queue

reactors deliberation scheduling queue

This structure is used to find a good scheduling order for the reactors deliberation. It sorts the reactors that needs to deliberate from the one with the largest workRatio to the one with smaller workRatio

TREX::transaction::TICK  final = 0,
Clock *  clock = NULL 
) [explicit]

Constructor.

Parameters:
[in] name The name of the agent
[in] final The value of the final tick for this mission
[in] clock A pointer to the clock that this agent will use

Create a new Agent named name with and intialize both its end and clock according to the optional arguments final and clock

Postcondition:
the agent has no reactor
Agent::Agent ( std::string const &  file_name,
Clock *  clock = NULL 
) [explicit]

Constructor.

Parameters:
[in] file_name A configuration file name
[in] clock A pointer to the clock that this agent will use.

Create a new Agent by parsing the onctent of the file file_name. If clock is not provided, it will take the first clock defined in file_name. Create a new Agent by parsing the content of the xml structure conf. If the clock has not beeen set yet, it will take the first clock defined in file_name.

An Agent configuration xml definition can be defined as follow: 

 <Agent name="<agent name>" finalTick="<final tick>" config="<extra cfg>" >
    <!-- plugin loading information -->
    <!-- clocks defintions -->
    <!-- reactors definitions -->
    <!-- goal definitions -->
 </Agent>

Where the attributes are as follow

  • name is the name of the agent
  • finalTick is a value greater than 0 that indicates the agent lifetime
  • config is an optional attribute that points to another XML file. this file will contains extra tags that will be parse in simlar mananer to the childs of this root tag.

the child tags will be parsed in the following order:

  • Plugin information allowing TREX to load external plugins. These XML tags have the following syntax : 
         <Plugin name="TREXvitre" />
    and will result on the attempting to load the dynamic libray TREXvitre as a TREX plugin. These need to be loaded firast as oner plugin can defines new clocks or reactors types used by this agent
  • Clock definition. These will be parsed only if a clock is not defined and as a result only the first clock definition may be parsed in this configuration The tag of the XML depends on the way the clock class declared itself inside TREX. And you need to look at the documentation of the clock class you want to use in order to know how to declare it in this file.
  • Reactors definition. these will define all the reactors that are declared initially on this agent. As for clock, the way to specify a reactor depends on the type of reactor and onwe should look at its documentation to know further
  • The initial goals for this mission. Goals have generic xml format that is described in TREX::transaction::Goal class documentation

This constructor will try first to locate file_name and if does not find it will try to locate file_name.cfg

Precondition:
file_name is a a valid file on current directory or accessible through TREX_PATH
file_name is a valid xml file that defines an agent
the root node of file_name needs to be an Agent tag
Exceptions:
TREX::utils::ErrnoExcept failed to locate the file
rapidxml::parse_error parse error while loading the file
TREX::utils::XmlError invalid XML content for agent configuration
TREX::utils::Exception one exception occured while laoding the agent
See also:
Agent::Agent(rapidxml::xml_node<> &, Clock *)
Agent::loadConf(std::string const &)

Member Function Documentation

bool Agent::doNext (  ) 

Execute for one tick.

This method execute all the reactors of the graphs for the current tick. This execution can be descibed as follow

  • TeleoReactor::newTick indicate to each reactor that a new tick have started
  • TeleoReactor::doSynchronize() require to each reactors to identify their current state based on the observation they did receive and potentially produce new observation on their intiernal timelines
  • TeleoReactor::workRatio() identify each reactor workload for scedulling their deliberation
  • TeleoReactor::step() is called only if a reactor have works (idenitifed by the fact that is workRatio() was not NAN). It allow the reactor to do a single step in roder to deliberate.

The function will return as soon as we reached the next tick.

Precondition:
initComplete should have been called before

true the mission is not finished

Return values:
false end of agent mission
Postcondition:
the current tick is larger than it was when we called this method
See also:
initComplete()
missionCompleted()

Definition at line 206 of file reactor_graph.hh.

Referenced by TREX::transaction::TeleoReactor::getGraphName(), and initComplete().

void Agent::initComplete (  ) 

Complete agent initialization.

Thsi function should be called before starting to execute an agent mission. It specifies to the agent that the initialization has been completed. This method makes final checks that :

  • the agent name is not empty
  • the agent have a clock associated
  • there's no cyclic dependencies between reactors

It will also use a TREX::agent::details::init_visitor to ensure that all the reactors can complete their initialization Finally it starts the clock alllowing the mission to be executed

See also:
TREX::agent::details::init_visitor
setClock(Clock *)
Exceptions:
CycleDetected There's a cyclic dependency between the reactors of this agent
AgentException The eagent is not correctly initialized

Here is the call graph for this function:

bool Agent::missionCompleted (  ) 

Check if mission is completed.

This methods indicates whehter tha mission of this agent has finished or not. Reasons for an agent to finish are one of the following:

  • the time of the clock is greater or equal to the deadline initially provided for this agent
  • the agent does not have anymore reactor in its graph
Return values:
true if the mission is finished
false otherwise

Definition at line 271 of file Agent.cc.

Referenced by doNext().

void Agent::run (  ) 

run the agent

This method runs the agent until its completes. It is just a simple utility method taht will call initComplete and then loop on a doNext() call untils this one returns false

Precondition:
The agent have a clock set
See also:
intiComplete()
doNext()

bool Agent::setClock ( Clock *  clock  ) 

Set agent clock.

Parameters:
[in] clock A clock

If the agent did not have a clock yet it is then associated to clock. Otherwise clock will be deleted

Return values:
true clock is now the clock of this agent
false this agent had already a clock and deleted clock
Precondition:
clock has been allocated in memory using the new operator
Postcondition:
the laifetime of clock is now taken coare by this agent. Do note that this post-condition is true no matter what value has been returned by this function.
